text: Which hydrocarbon is 84.1% carbon by mass?
Lithium hydrogen carbonate, LiHCO3, decomposes when heated to form Li2O, CO2, and H2O. How many moles of H2O are formed when 0.50 mol LiHCO3 decomposes?
A vessel contains 66 g CO2 and 16 g O2 at a pressure of 10.0 atm. What is the partial pressure of CO2?

First-generation automobile airbags were inflated by the decomposition of sodium azide (M = 65.02): 2 NaN3(s) → 2 Na(s) + 3 N2(g) What mass of sodium azide would be required to inflate a 16.0 L airbag to a pressure of 1.20 atm at 17 ºC?
Which of the following combinations will produce a 0.4 M NaCl solution?

options.A: Mixing 500 mL of 0.4 M NaOH with 500 mL of 0.4 M HCl
options.B: Mixing 300 mL of 1.2 M NaOH with 600 mL of 0.6 M HCl
options.C: Mixing 500 mL of 0.4 M NaCl solution with 500 mL water
options.D: Diluting 400 mL of 0.6 M NaCl with water to a final volume of 1.0 L

text: Which solute, when dissolved in 1 kg H2O, will give the solution with the highest boiling point?

options.D:
50 g glyoxal, HCOCHO
IONS the corresponding space on the answer sheet using a soft, #2 ide to change an answer, erase the unwanted mark very carefully. s for which more than one response has been blackened will not er correctly. It is to your advantage to answer every question.

text: A solution of which compound gives a violet flame test?
Addition of 1 M HBr to 0.1 M solutions of which compound results in evolution of a colorless gas?
Which solid is least soluble in water at 298 K?
Which methods would be suitable for determining the concentration of an aqueous solution of KMnO4? I. Visible spectrophotometry (colorimetry) II. Redox titration

The concentration of sulfate ion in a solution is measured by precipitating the sulfate as BaSO4, filtering the precipitate on ashless filter paper, and heating the filter paper and precipitate in a tared crucible with a Bunsen burner. Which error will result in a sulfate concentration that is higher than the actual concentration?

options.A: The empty crucible contains a few drops of water when it is tared.
options.B: A glass fiber filter is used instead of ashless filter paper.
options.C: Some fine precipitate is not captured by the filter.
options.D: Some of the sulfate-containing solution spills before the BaCl2 solution is added.

text: Which is the best way to dispense liquids using a volumetric pipet?

options.A: The pipet is immersed in the liquid to be dispensed, then lifted with a gloved finger on the top and the liquid allowed to drain to the mark. The remaining contents are then allowed to drain into the desired container.
options.B: The pipet is immersed in the liquid to be dispensed, then lifted with a gloved finger on the top and the liquid allowed to drain to the mark. The remaining contents are then allowed to drain into the desired container, with a pipet bulb used to gently blow out any residual droplets.
options.C: The tip of the pipet is submerged below the surface of the liquid and suction is applied using a pipet bulb until the liquid rises above the level of the mark. A gloved finger is then applied to the top of the pipet and the liquid allowed to drain to the mark. The remaining contents are then allowed to drain into the desired container.
options.D: The tip of the pipet is submerged below the surface of the liquid and suction is applied by mouth until the liquid rises to the level of the mark. The contents are then allowed to drain into the desired container.

text: Which gas at 600 K has the same effusion rate as methane (CH4) at 150 K?
In which are the ionic solids ranked in order of increasing melting point?
A two-dimensional slice through the lattice of a crystalline solid containing two different elements X and Y is shown schematically and to scale below. What type of solid is it?

options.A: A metallic alloy such as FeCr
options.B: A molecular solid such as IBr
options.C: An ionic compound such as LiCl
options.D: A network covalent solid such as SiC

text: A portion of the phase diagram of uranium hexafluoride (UF6) is shown below. Which statements are correct? I. UF6 sublimes at atmospheric pressure. II. At 80 ºC and 1.5 atm, only UF6(g) is present at equilibrium.
One unit cell of a crystal containing elements X, Y, and Z is shown below. What is its formula?
Which sample has the greatest entropy at a given temperature?
For an endothermic reaction to be spontaneous under standard conditions at constant pressure at some temperature T, which must be true?

options.A: The entropy change ∆Sº must be positive and greater than ∆Hº/T.
options.B: The entropy change ∆Sº must be positive and less than ∆Hº/T.
options.C: The entropy change ∆Sº must be negative and greater than –∆Hº/T.
options.D: The entropy change ∆Sº must be negative and less than –∆Hº/T.

text: For a constant-pressure process, what is the difference between the internal energy change (∆U) and the enthalpy change (∆H)?
What is the standard enthalpy of formation of SiF4(g)? SiO2(s) + 4 HF(aq) → SiF4(g) + 2 H2O(l) ∆Hºrxn = 4.6 kJ mol–1 Compound SiO2(s) HF(aq) H2O(l) SiF4(g) ∆Hºf, kJ mol–1 –910.9 –320.1 –285.8 ???
What is ∆Gº at 298 K for the following reaction? Ba2+(aq) + SO42–(aq) BaSO4(s)

The following data were collected for the reaction of A and B: [A]0 (M) [B]0 (M) Initial rate (M/s) 0.20 0.20 600 0.60 0.40 7200 0.60 0.80 28800 What is the order of the reaction with respect to A and B?

options.A: 0th order in A, 2nd order in B
options.B: 1st order in A, 1st order in B
options.C: 2nd order in A, 1st order in B
options.D: 1st order in A, 2nd order in B

text: A sample of 0.900 mol N2O is placed in a sealed container, where it decomposes irreversibly to N2 and O2 in a first-order reaction. After 42.0 min, 0.640 mol N2O remains. How long will it take for the reaction to be 90.0% complete?
The rate of a reaction is 2.3 times faster at 60 ºC than it is at 50 ºC. By what factor will the rate increase on going from 60 ºC to 70 ºC?

options.A: By less than a factor of 2.3
options.C: By more than a factor of 2.3
options.D: The rate increase cannot be determined from the information given.

text: How may an enzyme inhibitor decrease the rate of a reaction catalyzed by the enzyme? I. The inhibitor may bind to the enzyme and block the active site. II. The inhibitor may shift the equilibrium of the reaction toward the starting materials.

An irreversible reaction, A + B → products, is studied under conditions where [B] >> [A]. When [B] = 0.10 M, a plot of 1/[A] vs. time is linear. When [B] = 0.30 M, the plot of 1/[A] vs. time is indistinguishable from the first plot within experimental error. What is the rate law for this reaction?

Tert-butyl alcohol reacts with aqueous hydrochloric acid to give tert-butyl chloride. (CH3)3COH(aq) + H+(aq) + Cl–(aq) → (CH3)3CCl(aq) + H2O(l) For this reaction, Rate = k[(CH3)3COH][H+]. With which mechanism is this rate law consistent?

options.B: (CH3)3COH(aq) + H+(aq) fast (CH3)3C(OH2)+(aq) (CH3)3C(OH2)+(aq) → (CH3)3C+(aq) + slow H2O(l) (CH3)3C+(aq) + Cl–(aq) → (CH3)3CCl(aq) fast
options.C: (CH3)3COH(aq) + Cl–(aq) → (CH3)3CCl(aq) slow + OH–(aq) OH–(aq) + H+(aq) → H2O(l) fast
options.D: (CH3)3COH(aq) → (CH3)3C+(aq) + OH–(aq) slow (CH3)3C+(aq) + Cl–(aq) → (CH3)3CCl(aq) fast OH–(aq) + H+(aq) → H2O(l) fast

text: The diagrams below represent the progress of a reaction of A → B, with molecules of A represented by solid circles and molecules of B represented by open circles. Which statement best describes the reaction at t = 1000 s?

options.A: The reaction is at equilibrium because the concentrations of A and B are no longer changing.
options.B: The reaction is not at equilibrium because not all of the A has been consumed.
options.C: The reaction is not at equilibrium because the concentrations of A and B are not equal.
options.D: The reaction is not at equilibrium because the positions of the molecules are still changing.

text: For which of the following reactions would the yield of products at equilibrium NOT increase at a higher pressure?
What is the molar solubility of Cr(OH)3 in a solution whose pH is maintained at 6.00?
SO3(g) SO2(g) + 1/2 O2(g) What is Kp at 400 K for the following reaction? 2 SO3(g) 2 SO2(g) + O2(g)
When the chemical equation is balanced, what is the ratio of the coefficient of Ag(s) to the coefficient of H2O(l)? __ Ag(s) + __ NO3–(aq) + __ H+(aq) → __ Ag+(aq) + __ NO(g) + __ H2O(l)

A current of 0.44 A is passed through a solution of a ruthenium nitrate salt, causing reduction of the metal ion to the metal. After 25.0 minutes, 0.345 g of Ru(s) has been deposited. What is the oxidation state of ruthenium in the nitrate salt?
What is the Ksp of Ca(OH)2 at 298 K? Half-Reaction Eº, V Ca2+(aq) + 2 e– → Ca(s) –2.87 V Ca(OH)2(s) + 2 e– → Ca(s) + 2 OH–(aq) –3.02 V
What is ∆Eº for this reaction? 2 Ag(s) + Cu2+(aq) + 2 Cl–(aq) → 2 AgCl(s) + Cu(s) Half-Reaction Eº, V AgCl(s) + e– → Ag(s) + Cl–(aq) 0.222 V Cu2+(aq) + 2 e– → Cu(s) 0.337 V

The standard cell potential of the following galvanic cell is 1.562 V at 298 K. Zn(s) | Zn2+(aq) || Ag+(aq) | Ag(s) What is the cell potential of the following galvanic cell at 298 K? Zn(s) | Zn2+(aq, 1.00 × 10–3 M) || Ag+(aq, 0.150 M) | Ag(s)
Which statement regarding the relative energies of monochromatic light with λ = 800 nm and monochromatic light with λ = 400 nm is correct?

options.A: 800 nm light has half as much energy per mole of photons as 400 nm light.
options.B: 800 nm light has the same energy per mole of photons as 400 nm light.
options.C: 800 nm light has twice as much energy per mole of photons as 400 nm light.
options.D: No conclusion may be drawn regarding the relative energy per mole of photons without knowing the intensity of the light.

text: How many electrons in a ground-state As atom in the gas phase have quantum numbers n = 3 and l = 1?
In which list are the elements in order of increasing first ionization energy?
What mode of radioactive decay does 66Cu undergo?
Which gas-phase atoms in their ground states are diamagnetic? I. Fe II. Zn
The boiling points of the alkali metals decrease from lithium to cesium. Which trend is most closely related to the decreasing boiling points?

options.A: Increasing atomic radius down the group
options.B: Increasing atomic mass down the group
options.D: Decreasing electron affinity down the group

text: Which statements correctly describe the geometry of the carbonate ion, CO32–? I. All three carbon-oxygen bond distances are the same. II. All three bond angles are 120º.
Which molecule has a trigonal pyramidal geometry?
Which resonance structure contributes the most to the overall bonding in nitrous oxide, N2O?
How many σ bonds and how many π bonds are present in allene, H2CCCH2?
Which aspect of metallic bonding best accounts for the characteristic malleability of metals?

options.B: Metals contain a lattice of positive ions.

text: Which compound can exhibit geometric isomerism?
Which structural features contribute to the low strain energy of cyclohexane? I. All bond angles are close to 109.5º. II. All C–H bonds on adjacent carbon atoms are staggered.
What reaction conditions most effectively convert a carboxylic acid to a methyl ester?
What is the maximum number of monosubstitution products of the aromatic substitution reaction shown?
Which compound is NOT considered aromatic?
To what elements are the phosphorus atoms in DNA bonded? I. C II. H
